Comments_List: I received a far deeper understanding of and appreciation for films and the tradition of cinema in America.

How Hollywood films developed, beginning with the silent era
Learned to appreciate cinematographic elements, like camera angles/ use of shadows/ score
I learned the common thematic narrative of classical Hollywood films and gained a fuller appreciation of film in general
The issues and history of Hollywood in its early days.
This was a fantastic course that introduced me to the Classical Hollywood era, giving me the tools to both analyse and appreciate the the wide variety of films made in this period.
I learned a great deal about early Hollywood cinema as well as how politics and sociology shaped it.

In this class, we covered many of the important creative choices, characters, directors, actors, and general trends in Classical Hollywood (many of which still influence today's major films).   After taking this class, I can see where many modern films and storylines got their inspiration, and how the culture of early Hollywood set a difficult precedent for power dynamics which people are now struggling to upheave.

I gained knowledge related to a filed of history I knew absolutely nothing about before starting this course. I now feel as though I understand the history of Hollywood in the first half of the twentieth century extremely well.
I learned about the aspects of classical Hollywood film, some of the most influential actors, directors, and writers and how the industry of Hollywood began and developed.

I have a knowledge of film that I didnt before. Professor Thomasson illuminated basic technical elements of film, the studio system of Hollywood, exposed me to a number of canonical films, and set me up to view films made today through a historical lens.
It is a Wr credit and my writing really did improve dramatically.
This was my first film class, and I learned a lot about how to analyze a film analytically. The course also exposed me to a vast selection of Classical Hollywood films that were truly excellent.

I expanded my knowledge of film and learned about the history of storytelling during the classical era of Hollywood. In class, we studied the film industry, the evolution of film genres over time, the people involved in making films (writers, directors, composers, actors, etc.), censorship, and representation.
I learned all about how the hollywood industry came to be and different nuances that influenced the way the studios and films developed.

You learn so much about the beginnings of Hollywood and how movies have evolved! It also gives a perspective on how many "layers" there are to a movies: before the lecture Prof. Thomasson would usually play the soundtrack from a movie related to that week, we'd learn the names of cinematographers, costume designers and stuntmen, and we'd discuss movies in the historical context.
There is truly that can be improved on. Camille is an incredibly dynamic lecturer who prepares an amazing repertoire of films to watch and section discussions were informative and interesting.
Lectures were always engaging because camille is a gem
Make the assholes who come into section without having seen the movie watch the film! They detract from the learning experience.

The professor is one of the best ones I've had at Yale. Prof. Thomasson is very knowledgeable, very well-prepared for the class and very passionate. She teaches with such care to her students, even remembering almost the names of all students in her class.

The course was a great survey of the different types of films made, the context in which they were created and the processes that went into creating such great entertainment. The course is a testament to Camille and her TAs.
The strengths of the course are Camille and her wonderful lectures! I am hard pressed to find a way for the course to be improved.
Best course & professor combo at Yale.

This class contained an abundance of interesting information, which was all taught in an interesting way.  Sometimes, though, I felt that it was difficult to retain all of the names of directors, films, and actors that we learned at one time.
The class was outstanding. Each lecture was fun, informative, and engaging. I cannot think of any improvements.

Camille Thomason and my TF, Carolyn Jacobs, honestly are both Yale angels. They are brilliant, engaging, kind women who are truly invested in enlightening their students of the magic and the downfalls of classical Hollywood. Professor Thomasson taught a variety of movies with enthusiasm and grace.

Professor Thomasson is one of the best people at Yale. I am so grateful to have had the privilege of listening to her impeccably crafted and thoughtful lectures. I love seeing her around campus now. She encourages you to pursue what you love in paper topics.
The amount of writing slowly increases throughout the semester, great feedback is given at every step. This really helps in the learning process and in improving writing.
Such a great course! Camille was an amazing professor and the films she chose were all incredibly worth watching.
The course was amazing. The film selections were always great representatives of their genres and lecture was always a treat to go to.
This course is incredibly engaging, fun, and educational -- I honestly can't think of a single weakness.
Everything was absolutely great.

The only thing I would change about this class is I'd have the lecture notes posted online just because they are so well written I'd like to be able to read them agin. The class is otherwise impeccable. The lectures and incredibly well thought out and would always leave me smiling, the assignments encourage you to do something you love and the sections are a good opportunity to discuss the things that have caught your attention in that week's screening.

This was truly the best class I've taken in my four years at Yale. Camille is an unbelievable lecturer who puts all of herself into each class, and invests deeply in the experience of each student in the course. I cannot recommend this class highly enough, no matter how experienced or inexperienced you are with film courses. Camille is a once-in-a-lifetime sort of professor.
would highly recommend this course - very light workload, yet an incredibly engaging and interesting course
One hundred percent, if just to see Camilles face and appreciate her aura twice a week.
If you have any interest in movies, this is the class you will want to take.

Absolutely take this class. One of my favorite, if not my favorite, courses I've taken at Yale. Professor Thomasson's lectures are so engaging and you come out with a good understanding of film and exposure to a lot of different classic movies.
Yes, this is a great introduction to the wonderful world of film and the intellectual delights available if you scratch beneath the surface of your regular movie-going experience.
Yes! Camille is very passionate and knowledgeable about the material and her ability to share this with students is, in my experience, unparalleled.
100% recommend.

Absolutely-- I think the topics covered in this class are important things for any student to know.  I don't plan on being a film major, but this class gave me an important perspective on the influence of film over the past century (including modern Hollywood).

Absolutely! No matter their engagement in film, anyone who enjoys watching movies and wants to learn about a history rarely covered in the classroom should take this class. Camille is honestly one of the best lecturers at Yale. Her style is truly unique and you won't want to miss any of her classes. If you have the chance to take this course, do!
I would absolutely recommend this class to every Yale student. It was a joy to go to lecture and all of the assignments were fun, manageable, and intellectually stimulating.
YES.
Absolutely, the material is really interesting. The first two classes are not representative of the whole semester. It is a fun and stimulating class.
I would absolutely recommend this course to anyone who can fit it in their schedules.

I would definitely recommend this course to another student. If you haven't taken any film courses, Classical Hollywood Narrative is a great introduction, and if you have, the subject is so interesting that there is plenty to gain from it.

Absolutely, yes. The goal of this course was to make everyone understand how Old Hollywood worked and fall in love with the films of that era - it 100% succeeded for me. I'd previously seen some classical Hollywood films, but not tons, and now I just want to keep watching them. I also loved learning about how the films were made, the people that made the films happen, the issues in Hollywood at the time, the structure of the storylines... it was all great. I knew going into this course that those were subjects I was interested in, but what really makes this class incredible for absolutely anyone is Camille Thomasson. She is clearly in love with the course material and makes that love felt in every lecture she teaches. This is the best class I've taken at Yale and Camille is the best professor I've had at Yale.

I would absolutely recommend this class to another student -- it's a really fun way to learn about film and the history around film. You get a writing credit, a fun discussion section, and weekly movie screenings. Take this class!!

I would definitely recommend this class to any person who thinks they may have any interest in classical hollywood. The class is extremely engaging, and the films are very interesting to watch. There was never a class that I didn't look forward to, and each class completely lived up to expectation.

I can't emphasize just how good this class is! I'm a STEM major and I was just looking for a Hu class, and finding this class might have been the best accident of my time at Yale. I would always leave lecture feeling so much joy (OK, sometimes sadness when we were talking about sexual exploitation) and just wishing it had been longer. Prof. Thomasson is probably the most amazing professor you'll ever encounter and you'd be missing out if you don't take this class.
